info.title: CHIPS On-boarding
info.description:
The CHIPS payment platform enables registered users/merchants to create a payment request token that can be paid with various MasterPass enabled payment applications available on the South African payments landscape.

Third parties can build their own wallet with the CHIPS® Value Store as the backend. The third party application will need to on-board their users into the CHIPS® Payment Network.

# Overview
[![CHIPS Onboarding Sequence Diagram](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/images/Providers/CHIPS/Onboarding-SequenceDiagram.png)][stoplight-flow]

* [Business details](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/api-documentation/api-publishers/chips-open-banking-platform/chips-user-onboarding)
* [Technical guides](https://stoplight.io/p/docs/gh/trustlink-apim/chips)



For more info on CHIPS®:
* [CHIPS home page](https://chips.co.za)
* [CHIPS for business](https://www.chips.co.za/payment-network/index.php/businesses)


# Getting Started
* Register on the [Trustlink API Marketplace](https://marketplace.trustlinkhosting.com/component/apiportal/registration)
* Send an email requesting access to the CHIPS Point of Sale: Token Based Payment API to apisales@trustlink.co.za

# Terms and Conditions
By using these APIs you agree to the following terms and conditions
1. [CHIPS Terms and Conditions](http://www.chips.co.za/downloads/CHIPS_Terms_Conditions_2019-07-25.pdf)
1. [AOS Terms and Conditions](http://www.chips.co.za/downloads/AOS_Terms_and_Conditions_2018-06-26.pdf)

[stoplight-flow]: https://stoplight.io/p/docs/gh/trustlink-apim/chips/docs/2-CHIPS-for-Individuals/01-CHIPS-Onboarding.md

get.summary: Check registration status based on mobile number

maskedName.description: If a registered user was found with the given mobileNumber, a masked displayname is returned to assist with possible support calls.

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceCode.description: Indicates status on the marketplace layer.
marketplaceCode.title: Markerplace layer status code

marketplaceMsg.title: Human readable message to provide more details on the *marketplaceCode*.
marketplaceMsg.example: An API subscription application for the requested URI was not found.
marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

marketplaceId.description: Marketplace request id for support and tracing queries.

marketplaceMocked.description:
Indicates if the response was generated by a marketplace mockup. This is only relevant to API that start with the /storefront and /sandbox paths. 
If true, the API was not passed on to the API provider backend, but the response is being mocked up the marketplace.
If false, it indicates that the API call was pushed through to the API provider backend. The backend in turn might have stubbed the response in order to prevent costs like SMS notifications.

regsitered.description: Indicates if a registered user was found with the given mobileNumber.

get.description:
Check registration status based on mobile number. If the number exists, the user is already has a profile under your wallet custodianship.

**Testing on Storefront and Sandbox**

The following mobileNumbers will have the following mocked responses for Storefront and Sandbox APIs. 

| mobileNumber | registered | uuid | maskedName | 
|---|---|---|---|
| +27851231234 | true | dfc4b21d-c87e-41e1-a775-fb5ba3ab85a2 | T... A.....t |
| +27853453456 | true | 176194f5-118d-41fa-bd65-e04b78b8a49a | G....e M.......d |
| +27856786789 | false |  |  |
| +27851112233 | false |  |  |

<!-- theme: info -->
> ### Note
> 
> For all other numbers Sandbox will lookup the status against the current Sandox data.

For Storefront all numbers will respond with as follows.
```json
{
  "uuid": "35c441d6-dd41-4c8b-b508-a7749de94aab",
  "maskedName": "J......n B....s",
  "registered": true,
  "apimStatus": {
    "marketplaceId": "Id-016c6f60b4017363caaea86b",
    "statusCode": 200,
    "marketplaceCode": 200,
    "providerCode": "200",
    "marketplaceMocked": true
  }
}
```

See [How it works] for more details on Storefront and Sandbox testing.

Get the [Storefront marketplaceKeyId] here.

[How it works]: https://trustlink.stoplight.io/docs/chips/docs/06-how-it-works.md
[Storefront marketplaceKeyId]: https://trustlink.stoplight.io/docs/chips/docs/1-CHIPS-Authorization/02-Demo-Authentication.md

parameters.name: mobileNumber
parameters.description: Mobile number in international format. Example +27821231234

get.description:
Request an OTP for a mobile number. The number will receive an SMS:

```
OTP: xxxxx
Your CHIPS generated verification code
```

> **Sandbox testing**
>
> The OTP sent to the phone does incur costs. For testing to the sandbox, the number of calls to the endpoint is rate limited.
> You can test with mobileNumbers starting with '+2785' to trigger a mockup success response.

parameters.name: mobileNumber
parameters.description: Mobile number to send the OTP to. Must be in international. Example +27831231234

schema.description: Mobile number the OTP was generated for. Must be in international format i.e. +27821231234

mobileNumber.description: Mobile number the OTP was generated for. Must be in international format i.e. +27821231234

otp.description: One Time Pin received on the requested mobileNumber

post.description:
Verify the OTP sent to mobile.

**Testing on Storefront and Sandbox**

The following mockups are available for testing

| mobileNumber | otp | Response |
|---|---|---|
| Starting with '+2785' | 45678 | Mocked Success (200) |
| Starting with '+2785' | Any other OTP | Mocked Failure (400) |

apimStatus.title: Status
apimStatus.description:
All responses from the marketplace will at least contain the *apimStatus* object.  The purpose is to inform the requester of status details above and beyond the HTTP status code.

Note that it is possible to have a success indicator on the marketplace layer, but have a unsuccessful indication on the *providerCode*. This in essence means that even if the API to the provider returned for example a 'not found' result, the request is still chargable on the marketplace layer.

The *providerCode* will only be present if the API was routed to the API Provider.

## Marketplace Codes

| Code | Description |
|------|---------------|
| 200 | Successfully serviced and charged. |
| 250 | Successfully serviced with no charge. |
| 401 | Unauthorized.  |
| 404 | Not Found. |
| 450 | Application Not Found. |
| 451 | Organization Not Found. |
| 500 | Internal Server Error. |

marketplaceMsg.description: Human readable description providing details about the error. On success the value will be 'Success'

providerCode.description: Error code returned API provider. The value is of type string seeing as the prodiver might respond with a string error code like 'ERRDB01'

statusCode.description: Same as the http status code

post.description: Register the ID and person details into the CHIPS system

email.description: User email address. Must be unique.

photo.description:
Selfie photo as base64 string with meta header.

Currently supported formats
* data:image/png;base64
* data:image/jpeg;base64
* data:application/pdf;base64

Recommended image size is 600x600

Use https://www.base64-image.de to generate examples.

referrerUuid.description:
CHIPS Account UUID of the referrer. 
Must be the merchant UUID if integrating a wallet ecosystem under a miBusiness merchant.
Must NOT be supplied if integrating as a wallet ecosystem owner (using BSSI Auth).

identityNumber.description: ID number as per RSA ID book

firstNames.description: First names as per RSA ID book. Space separated.

surname.description: Surname as per RSA ID book.

countryOfBirth.description:
Country of Birth abbreviation. 
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.
ZA for South Africa.

photo.description:
Photo of ID book or card. Encoded in base 64 with  header.

Currently supported formats
* data:image/png;base64
* data:image/jpeg;base64
* data:application/pdf;base64

Recommended image size is 600x600.

Use https://www.base64-image.de to generate examples.

firstNames.description: First names as per Passport. Space separated.

countryOfIssue.description: Country the passport is issued in. ISO 3166-1 aplha-2.

dateOfIssue.description: Date the passport was issued. Format yyyy-mm-dd

dateOfExpiry.description: Date passport will expiry on. Format yyyy-mm-dd

photo.description:
Photo of passport page with personal information. Encoded in base 64 with header.

Currently supported formats
* data:image/png;base64
* data:image/jpeg;base64

Recommended image size is 600x600.

Use https://www.base64-image.de to generate examples.

mobileNumberToken.description: OTP sent to mobile number at the start of the onboarding process.

status.description: Status of the individual at Home Affairs

marriedDate.description: Date of marriage (YYYY-MM-DD). If requested, but not recorded, the field will not be present.

deceasedDate.description: Date of death (YYYY-MM-DD). If requested, but not recorded OR the person is not deceased, the field will not be present.

initials.description: Initials as per Home Affairs. If requested, but not recorded the field will not be present.

post.description:
Verify a person's ID details prior to onboarding. 

<!-- theme: info -->

> ### **Note**
>
> The ID verification is built into the [POST register/persons](b3A6NTYzMDg5-create-a-profile) API. Only use this pre-verification if there a precess to be followed in between getting the person's ID details and the account creation.

identityNumber.description: ID number as per RSA ID book

firstNames.description: First names as per RSA ID book. Space separated.

surname.description: Surname as per RSA ID book.

countryOfBirth.description:
Country of Birth abbreviation. 
ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code.
ZA for South Africa.

photo.description:
Photo of ID book or card. Encoded in base 64 with  header.

Currently supported formats
* data:image/png;base64
* data:image/jpeg;base64
* data:application/pdf;base64

Recommended image size is 600x600.

Use https://www.base64-image.de to generate examples.
